oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis and characterization of mesoporous ferrisilicate (FeMCM-41) molecular sieves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BADAMALI, SK
SELVAM, P
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: zeolites
mcm-41
iron
silicate
analogs
oxides
zsm-5
epr
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A systematic investigation of iron substituted mesoporous silicate (FeMCM-41) was carried out. The incorporation of the trivalent iron into the framework as well as the nature of such ions in the mesoporous matrix is presented. The results are discussed in terms of the information obtained using various analytical techniques, viz., XRD, TG, DRUV-VIS, FTIR and ESR, as well as chemical analysis and surface area measurements.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: RECENT ADVANCES IN BASIC AND APPLIED ASPECTS OF INDUSTRIAL CATALYSIS,113,749-758
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 13th National Symposium and Silver Jubilee Symposium of Catalysis of India,DEHRA DUN, INDIA,APR 02-04, 1997
